title: Arithmetic/Bitwise Operators (+, -, *, /, %, &, |, ^, <<, >>, TBB overflow)
description: Complete specification for all arithmetic and bitwise operators in Aria, including TBB sticky error propagation for overflow/underflow conditions.

arithmetic_semantics: What overflow behavior exists (wrap, trap, saturate, TBB ERR)?
How does TBB sticky error propagate (ERR + X → ERR)?
How does division by zero behave (TBB ERR)?
How do mixed-type operations work (int + flt → flt)?
bitwise_semantics: How do shifts handle large counts (>= bit width)?
How do bitwise ops work on TBB ERR?
tbb_integration: What operations trigger ERR (overflow, underflow, div-by-zero)?
How is ERR detected in codegen (flag checks)?
How does TBB interact with floating-point (flt32 + ERR)?
optimization: What strength reduction (mul by power-of-2 → shift)?

deliverables: Code examples with TBB error handling
